result.execSummary:
All charges against Patrick M Tesar Jr. in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick M Tesar Jr. is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M Tesar Jr.

defendant.name: Tesar, Patrick M, Jr.
defendant.address: 1515 S Beaumont Road, Prairie Du Chien, WI 53821

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
10:11 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Patrick M Tesar Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Frank is heard on plea and sentencing agreement. Defendant to plead in 21CF92 to count 1, counts 2 & 3 and case 22CF06 and 22CF67 to be dismissed. Attorney Frank is heard on the agreement of count 1 - two years probation and 90 conditional jail. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court accepts the defendants no contest plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

State moves to dismiss count 2 & 3 in case 21CF92 and all charges in 22CF06 and 22CF67.
Court orders on states motion to dismiss. 

State is heard on sentencing recommendations. 2 years probation, 90 days jail and to participate and follow through with any assessments, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections. States request that pre sentence confinement is credited. 

Attorney Frank is heard on sentencing and requests probation. 
No Comment by Defendant. 

Court orders sentence withheld - 2 years probation. 60 days jail, stay that for up to 30 days. Defendant to report to jail no later than Sept 8th, @ 6:30 PM. Huber/EM approved. 78 days jail credit if probation is revoked. Conditions imposed - Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Court orders defendant to be tested 1x per month. Undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with treatment. Other conditions are what is deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections. Court Costs of $518.00 - 6 months to pay. Apply bond money from these cases to the court costs, the remainder of the bonds to be returned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:13 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court cancels all warrants.
     D.A. asks one case bond be raised by an addtl. $500 cash.
     Atty. Frank responds; believes matters are resolved; could do plea/sentencing in the near future.
     As to bond, Court comments.  Court increases bond in 21CF92 by an addtl. $1,000.00.  Bonds in other cases remain as set.  Nonmonetary conditions remain the same in 21CF92.
     Court concludes at 1:18 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:00 PM Call to Order by Court (#21-CF-92, #22-CF-06 & #22-CF-67).  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Jr. not in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Patrick M Tesar Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
     3:06 p.m. - no appearance by Def.  Atty. Frank comments; was to meet with Def. today at 2:30 p.m.; knows he has been informed of today's date and reminded of it.
     Court issues a warrant on these cases; to be held until brought before the court.
     Court concludes at 3:08 p.m.

11:02 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Jr. appeared by video . Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Mark Frank is heard on the status of the three cases. 
21CF92 / 22CF06 / 22CF67

Atty Frank requests that the cases be set for plea and sentencing. 

Court confirms mailing address with defendant and also verbally confirms the time and date of the plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:40 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Patrick M Tesar Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Frank requests a few moments to discuss matter with def. Court places Atty. Frank and def in a breakout room - 
3:48 PM - back on record

Atty. Frank  states that def. intends to waive the preliminary hearing and requests arraignment be held today, will demand a speedy trial and a jury status hearing that can be a plea/sentencing date.

Def. waives right to preliminary hearing.
Court reviews preliminary hearing questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding
Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings

State files Information at this time

Court shares screen with defendant
Def. waives reading and stands mute

Clerk to enter NOT GUILTY  plea to each count

Jury Status hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00  (can be a Plea/Sentencing - but then must appear in person)
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Mark Frank

11:43 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Frank appeared via video on behalf of the defendant. 

Atty Frank is heard. 
Court screen shares criminal complaint with Atty Frank. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 03:40 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with  A.P. Defendant shall have no contact with 229 S Michigan Street.

1:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick Michael Tesar Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with  AP. Defendant shall have no contact with 229 S Michigan Street.

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with  AP. Defendant shall have no contact with 229 S Michigan Street.

Court advises right to an attorney
Hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
